definitions: To discard or get rid of something unwanted.
To expel or remove someone from a place or group.
To produce or emit something, often quickly or unexpectedly.
To reject or dismiss a proposal, idea, or case.
examples: Please throw out the old newspapers.
The bouncer had to throw out the disruptive customer.
The volcano began to throw out ash and smoke.
The judge decided to throw out the case due to lack of evidence.
The sudden change in plans seemed to throw out the whole team.
